ConfigItem.Desc: An audio prompt will be played when the event selected in this column occurs.
This column specifies the index of the audio prompt file in the VM application file system. This field is autogenerated by the Configuration Tool and should not be directly written by the user.

This column specifies the VM application system states for which the configured audio prompt can be played. If the configured event occurs and the VM application is in a state masked off, then the audio prompt will not be played.
When checked the audio prompt will not be played if SCO or wired audio is currently routed.
When checked any queued audio prompts or tones will be flushed prior to playing this audio prompt.
When checked an audio prompt configured to indicate an incoming call will play to completion, even if the call is answered immediately or the call terminates.

ConfigItem.Id: Read out Incoming Caller Phone Number using Audio Prompts
ConfigItem.Desc: When checked, appropriately preconfigured audio prompts are played in sequence to 'speak' an incoming caller number.

ConfigItem.Id: Read out PIN Code using Audio Prompts
ConfigItem.Desc: When checked, appropriately preconfigured audio prompts are played in sequence to 'speak' PIN/Passkey/Confirmation messages.

ConfigItem.Id: Time Before Confirming Audio Prompt Set [s]
ConfigItem.Desc: When changing the audio prompt set currently selected, it is possible to have this change automatically confirmed and stored. This setting is a time specified as a number of seconds. If it is configured with a non-zero value, the audio prompt set change will be committed to non-volatile storage after this number of seconds has elapsed.

This setting specifies the number of audio prompt sets used by the Audio Prompt feature (an audio prompt set could, for example, contain all the prompts configured for a particular language). Note: in order to use the Audio Prompt feature, this setting must be confgured to at least 1.
This item indicates whether the Audio Prompt feature is enabled.
This item stores the selected audio prompt set.
This item stores the number of audio prompts configured in the event to audio prompt mapping table.
